page.title: 12LEE MOOR AREA-FARMING.
page.content: The area is on the edge of Dartmoor and the type of farming which goes on tends to be of a moorland nature.There are many sheep roaming around the china clay workings.These are mainly kept for their wool.The sheep are not fenced in and are able to wander onto the roads,which leads to some of them being killed by motor vehicles.There are also a few moorland cattle kept in the area,grown for their meat.The quality of the grass in the area is not generally good enough for dairy cattle to be kept.There are a few Dartmoor ponies in the area which when old enough are sold at auction for riding.There is a riding stable at Tinpark Farm.The soil is not generally good enough for arable crops to be grown,although the soil is better on the lower slopes.
